title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Disappointing earnings reports from several big companies don't seem to be fazing investors, with the S&P 500 up nearly 5% this month, and 2.5% last week, after a punishing start to the year.

---

Elon Musk engaged in a brief affair last fall with the wife of Sergey Brin, prompting the Google co-founder to file for divorce earlier this year and ending the tech billionaires' long friendship, according to people familiar with the matter.

---

Growing signs that price pressures are easing suggest that June's 9.1% increase in consumer prices will probably be the peak. But even if inflation comes down, economists see a slow pace of decline.

---

VW's new chief executive, a backer of the transition to electric cars, also supports electrofuels, combustible synthetics that offer a different approach to lower emissions.

---

Wealthy people ramped up their borrowing in the first half of the year despite rising rates and a stock-market rout that hit the value of their portfolios.

---

Delays at Toronto's Pearson International have emerged this year as the worst among the world's top 100 airports by number of flights during a summer of air-travel disruptions.

---

Walt Disney on Friday began streaming R-rated movies on its Disney+ service for the first time, as the company pushes further into adult-focused entertainment.
